intro: Hyacinthella micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered hyacinthella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces bell-shaped blooms in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is appreciated by gardeners interested in cultivating rare and exotic plants.
